snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission plans rules that will require companies to trade most derivatives contracts through regulated exchanges and force most derivatives deals to go through clearinghouses.
abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission plans rules that will require companies to trade most derivatives contracts through regulated exchanges and force most derivatives deals to go through clearinghouses.

headline.main: Regulator Releases 'Road Map' on Swaps Overhaul

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
